welcome.a_software_for_the_provision: a software for the provision of CPEs, monitoring and control of multi-technology networks, specifically designed for operators that use GPON, DOCSIS and WiFi/WiMAX as access technologies.
welcome.its_multi-brand_approach: Its multi-brand approach allows it to be compatible with different manufacturers, both for CPEs and aggregation equipment (CMTS, OLT, AP).
welcome.responsively_designed_so_that: responsively designed so that you can use the features whether it is used from a computer or a mobile device.
welcome.the_fact_of_accessing_the_tool: The fact of accessing the tool from anywhere and at any time allows the operator, based on the large amount of information available, to make the appropriate decision.
welcome.in_the_menu_on_the_left: In the menu on the left side panel you can access all the sections and sections of
welcome.or_any_of_the_order_modules: , or any of the other modules that are installed.
welcome.from_a_quick_access_to_network: From a quick access to network problems, as well as different quick filters (within the Overview submenu) to locate the different resources that are in it.
welcome.we_can_also_access_a: We can also access a series of Tactical Views that allow us to display and organize the information of different elements of your network: Matrix, Smart Tree, UNs pending provisioning, Radius sessions, etc.
welcome.the_top_bar_includes_a_general: The top bar includes a general search engine, which, based on different keywords (tokens), allows you to search and filter any type of element on the network. It also allows you to store your favorite searches for later use.
welcome.from_here_we_can_also: From here we can also change the display mode of the results on the screen between: List, MineMap, WorldMap, Matrix, Smart Tree, etc.
welcome.on_the_right_side_of: On the right side of this toolbar we are shown the current user with whom we are logged, and a drop-down menu in which we can change different parameters, such as the refresh interval, mute the sounds, or receive notifications from the browser.
welcome.the_krillUI_home_page: The KrillUI home page can be customized with various Widgets, which will allow you to display the general status of the network, the most critical incidents of hosts and services, the health status of the monitoring system, etc.
welcome.later_new_widgets_will: Later, new Widgets will be incorporated that will allow to provide more functionality to this screen.
welcome.to_add_a_widget_we_can_do: To add a widget, we can do it from the bottom right button of the screen, clicked on the one that interests us. The widget will be added to the first free gap it detects on the screen.
welcome.to_move_or_resize_a_widget: To move or resize a widget we must first click on the padlock icon that appears in its header
welcome.after_this_a_button_will: . After this, a button will be enabled next to its title
welcome.which_will_allow_us_to_move: , which will allow us to move it, and another on the lower right corner to be able to resize it
welcome.to_remove_a_widget: To remove a widget, once unlocked, we must click on the trash can button that will appear on the right side of the header
welcome.you_can_add_this: You can add this Widget again from the lower right button whenever you want.
